results.title: Process control
results.brief_description: Explains how simple statistical methods may be used in the quality control of manufactured products. Illustrates how individual product measurements may be used to compile frequency distribution curves, average and range measurements. Explains how control charts, plotted from average and range figures, may be used to control the accuracy of a manufactured product.

results.title: Proboscis
results.creator_credit: Rebecca McLean, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Penny Gosonski and her family had an accident on their way to their holiday destination. Apart from her father’s death, the worst fate Penny had to face was the loneliness of being the sole heir to the family’s attribute. A large nose that could send a thousand balloons into flight. Cast includes Julia Fernandez, Bree-Anna Obst and Phillipa Hagen.

results.title: Problems to be solved
results.brief_description: A restrained dramatic presentation of the problems of personal relationships and private worries in the office. A cleaner find mute evidence of the past day’s tensions as she moves around each desk. The office boy feels he is learning nothing; a clerk is extremely tense; a young mother worried about the child who must be left alone in the house; an executive is continually short-tempered and panicky; the manger has too full a timetable to do more than notice the existence of these problems.

results.title: Problems of World Order
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a problem or development which has implications for the whole world and which can only be solved through international cooperation. The divide between the rich and the poor nations of the world is highlighted.

results.title: Problems of the Middle East
results.brief_description: The four basic problems of the Middle East: minorities, agriculture, industries and education are discussed. The area has been the home of many civilizations each of which has left its influence on the cultural, religious, and social life of the country so that you get a number of ethnic groups proud of their history, language and religion and resisting the domination of ruling governments. The conflict between Israel and the Arab nation is discussed and the conditions of life is Israel are shown.

results.title: Problems of pupil adjustment. Part 1: the dropout
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
The case study of high school student who left school as son as the law permitted. The reasons swy his school failed to meet his needs are examined and the type of curriculum that did not hold his interest is discussed. A life-adjustment programme is suggested in which class subjects are more closely related to the interested and needs of the students.

group_siblings.title: Problems of pupil adjustment Pt.2 the stay in

results.title: Problems of pupil adjustment Pt.2 the stay in
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
A portrayal of a modern American school in which the curriculum concentrates on meeting the needs of the students. Here learning is done in terms of adjustment to everyday problems. There are classes in English, biology, civics, drawing, aviation, poultry raising, and other fundamentals to modern living. Each subject is translated in terms of pupil experience and pupil needs. With such enrichments of the school curriculum, the pupil appreciates the relationship between his in-school and out-of school activities; the drop out problem cases to exist for the ground on which it flourished has been removed.

results.title: Problems of housing: the individual home
